results.title: Social control
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams, Coast Community College District and Holt, Rinehart and Winston
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “Faces of culture”.
All humans have to co-exist with other humans and for this to be a peaceful co-existence there must be some form of social control. Societies have therefore developed rules, habits and customs which are learned from childhood, in order to control behaviour. This program looks at different patterns of control, using as examples the Amish of Pennsylvania, the Masai, and the United Nations. It also explains the principles of mediation, adjudication and judgement and gives examples of these. Narrated by David Carradine.

results.title: Social behaviour of the Rhesus Monkey (Mucaca mulatta)
results.creator_credit: C.R. Carpenter and Pennsylvania State College Productions
results.brief_description: Shows large numbers of rhesus monkeys living in a semi-natural environment, with special emphasis on social interactions, both of individuals and of organised groups. The interactions illustrated are those of: male and female, female and young, male and male, female and female, young and young, and male and young. Kinds of behaviour shown include: reproductive, maternal. (NB: Restricted to members of the medical profession and to supervised classes of medical and psychology students.)

results.title: So young
results.creator_credit: Fiona Cochrane, Lou Hibbard and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: Broadmeadows, in Melbourne’s northern suburbs, is Australia’s largest public housing estate, with the largest concentration of single parent families in the country. The young mothers featured in this video all participate in the activities of the Broadmeadows Women’s House, a drop-in centre which provides child-care and peer support. For most of the women, who have been deserted by their partners and families, the centre provides an opportunity to regain confidence and self-esteem. The women discuss their struggles with abusive partners, a suspicious welfare system and a general community which treats single parents with prejudice and a lack of compassion. This excellent video explores the lives of teenage single mothers with clear-headed insight and on the women’s own terms.

results.title: So You Want to Stop Smoking
results.brief_description: If you really want to stop smoking, this video is for you. We can’t promise it will be easy, but if you have the desire, then here is the motivation, confidence, will-power and support you need to stop and stay stopped. This step-by-step programme answers your questions, gives firm advice, and most of all, gives support - support when your willpower flags, when the craving becomes unbearable, when you feel like giving in. Even when your guard slips and you accidentally take a cigarette, it will cheer you up, prop you up, and keep you going. Kick the habit with us and begin a healthier and happier life today.

results.title: So you want to own a pony
results.creator_credit: Dept of Home Affairs, Robert Talbot and Associates and Shell Company of Australia
results.brief_description: Owning one’s first pony is great fun but there can be pitfalls for the unwary. The Pony Club’s role in helping newcomers is well explained. A film for beginners and parents regarding the responsibilities of caring for a horse and the basics of riding.

results.title: So you're getting a divorce
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This dramatised documentary made in conjunction with the Family Court of Australia aims at assisting people considering a divorce. Showing the main functions of the Family Court, the video provides you with an understanding of these processes. It clearly explains issues such as Simple Dissolution, Conciliation Conference, Finmancial Settlements, Property, Custody and the implications of Contested Litigation.

results.title: So small my island
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: Japan is a country which is both new and old. This film shows how the traditions of Japanese life are still very much part of a nation which is also modern and industrialised. The people are hard-working, for a little land must go a long way, A love of beauty and politeness is an essential part of their lives,. Festivals, geisha girls and shrines for worship are some of the traditional aspects depicted in this beautiful country.

results.title: So much to give: a report from Anne Deveson
results.creator_credit: Betti Wood, Warwick Olson and Pilgrim Productions
results.brief_description: Seeks to develop community awareness of the needs of mentally handicapped children. Shows interviews with parents, teachers, doctors and social workers involved with these children. Script and voice - Anne Deveson.
